intro: Linaria tartessiana, commonly known as the Spanish toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its linear, grass-like leaves are arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces slender, branching stems that support its showy blooms. Linaria tartessiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
